result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Schoonover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas A. Schoonover is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas A. Schoonover was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:22 pm - Defendant Nicholas A. Schoonover in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Cirilli/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Court Costs $243/DNA Surcharge $200
Jail 10 days w/Huber for all purposes - May serve in Chippewa County - Jail credit 1 day - To commence on/before  7-10-15 at 4 pm
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

2:33 p.m. Defendant Nicholas A. Schoonover in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli statement-offer made/no resolution at this time. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
State  and State's Demand for Discoverys Reply to Discovery

Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:39
Authorization filed- In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:05 pm - Defendant Nicholas A. Schoonover in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
